content.description: On the right side facing the waterÂ start with low feet and hands on the only really prominent sizable hold, and climb straight up.
content.protection: Multiple pads are nice because of all the rocks around, and a spotter is nice, too.
content.location: This is on the big boulder between the trail and the chasm on the side facing the big chasm.
Facing the water, it is on the left side of the boulder.

content.description: Stand under the steep side with a high right on a vertical crack. High step on the larger of the two small features. Paste your feet, and move up and right for the top. The full sit start on lower holds is much harder.
content.location: This is on the backside of the boulder away from the water.

content.description: Start with low feet and hands on the big hold (same start as Unknown Problem 1), but move up and left around the arete, with a big move left to a high left crimp. From there, move straight up.
content.protection: Pads (multiple), and a spotter is nice.
content.location: Use the same start as Unknown Problem 1, but move left around the arete and then up for the top.

content.description: There are a few nice seaside bouldering problems around Rafe's Chasm. If anyone knows more detail about the problems here or the history of bouldering here, then please contact me so I can add it to the page.
